repnme.cdata!:
Madagascar - First, Second and Third
            Poverty Reduction Support Operation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Poverty Reduction
            Support Operations (PRSC I) for Madagascar are as follows:
            outcome was moderately satisfactory, risk to the development
            outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also rated
            moderately satisfactory. Ratings for the Second Poverty
            Reduction Support Operations (PRSC II) for Madagascar are as
            follows: outcome was moderately satisfactory, risk to the
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            also rated satisfactory. Ratings for the Third Poverty
            Reduction Support Operations (PRSC III) for Madagascar are
            as follows: outcome was moderately satisfactory, risk to the
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also rated
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: 1) PRSCs I-III
            rightly focused on the critical areas of public finance
            management and human development. Future PRSCs may want to
            deepen support in these areas and focus on critical
            bottlenecks rather than broadening the areas of support to
            new areas. It may also be important to identify the
            institutional and absorptive capacities of each sector, to
            provide budget support to those sectors with the highest
            capacities and to use PRSCs in combination with sectoral
            projects to those areas where capacities are lowest. 2) The
            amount provided under the form of budget support has been
            revised downward for a better balance of overall Bank
            support between budget support and projects. The next series
            of PRSCs which would consist of three annual operations for
            US$40 million each seems to strike an adequate balance.
            Increase in budget support could be linked to credible and
            sustained improvement in revenue collection, civil service,
            and public sector management systems. 3) Both the Bank and
            the Government need to have realistic expectations about the
            breadth and pace of reform implementation. In particular,
            the political appetite for reforms must be aligned with the
            country's technical capacity to implement and absorb
            these reforms.

repnme.cdata!:
Madagascar - Second Poverty Reduction
            Support Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
A series of single tranche Poverty
            Reduction Support Credits (PRSCs), provided in the form of
            budget support, aims to support implementation of
            Madagascar's Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP).
            The series of PRSCs will contribute to Madagascar reaching
            its development goals. Specifically, the reforms supported
            will strengthen the institutional infrastructure needed to
            improve the public sector's capacity to carry out its
            role more effectively. In addition, strengthened monitoring
            and evaluation will lead to an enhanced accountability and
            results focus. Improved delivery of public services is
            essential if the Government is to reach its goals for
            poverty reduction and improve the quality of life in Madagascar.
